author: Shiv Sahay Singh
text:
Starting the campaign for the Assembly elections in West Bengal, Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee on Tuesday took out a five-kilometre march from Shyambazar to Esplanande.

Though the rally was organised by the Trinamool Congress to commemorate Women’s Day, slogans in support of the ruling party and against the Opposition were raised. Along with the Trinamool Congress chairperson, who is contesting from Bhawanipore, Women and Child Development Minister Sashi Panja, Minister for Housing and Youth Affairs Arup Biswas and Vaishali Dalmiya, daughter of cricket administrator, the late Jagmohan Dalmiya, participated in the march.

After walking for a brief stretch, Ms. Banerjee paid floral tributes to the statue of Swami Vivekananda at his ancestral house. Ms. Banerjee concluded the rally by raising the slogans that she had coined last week. — Shiv Sahay Singh
title: Mamata starts campaign
